messages.subject: OST Millenium Actress (Sennen Joyu)
messages.msgSnippet: Many years back there was discussion on the internet about how the film possibly contained a cameo of Rurouni Kenshin in the animated feature Millenium
messages.messageBody:
Many years back there was discussion on the internet about how the film
possibly contained a cameo of Rurouni Kenshin in the animated feature
Millenium Actress. Essentially someone saw a red headress in the Boshin
War painting (it's an exact copy of a famous ukiyo-e) and they thought it
was the manga/anime character. It's an honest mistake (^_^) still
perhaps floating on a fan messageboard.

I still encourage people who have exhausted the live-action Shinsengumi
films to rent this film---now available widely in vid stores across the USA.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Posted on (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SHQ/message/1941)
December 2004 by secretarytocapt3

> ***MILLENIUM ACTRESS*** (contains Shinsengumi cameo AND the
2nd disk of the dvd
> shows a Shinsengumi cosplayer they used as a model AND starring RK
> Saitou's voice actor Hiroaki Suzuoki AND animates Boshin War art).
>
> ***MILLENIUM ACTRESS*** basically takes you on a tour of Japanese
> history via film...and plenty of inside jokes for people who love
> chambara....film made me cry...

Recently I had to thank someone for finding me a rare work of music so I
had to extract the entire OST of M.A. as a trade---and I wanted to share it
here as well.

Basic info:
Imdb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0291350/
Trailer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpGrD5wUzKE
Much better trailer from Japan: http://www.youtube.com/watch?
v=0uRjP_LqJcY

Millenium Actress is a film .. about films, namely the golden era of
Japanese cinema paralleled with the history of Japan from ancient to
modern times (including wars). The art and writing of this work is top
notch. If you watch the film and keep in mind that Chiyoko the main
character -is- Japan you get a very good interpretation because her
maturity during various periods in history is very fascinating.

Almost all tracks are instrumental with a bit of vocals. However the last
song is entirely in Japanese and you can preview it here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5E5PmsPwf0E

the rest of the OST has a very interesting spiritual, adventure and
technology mix to it (because the tracks are based on the movies the main
character, an actress, performs in).

Enjoy!
http://www.megaupload.com/?d=AW79BRS4
(buy) http://tinyurl.com/5u4y5j (don't buy the fake CDs on Ebay get it
from Japan---the CD comes with a music vid)

do not attempt to download this OST from torrent/anime sites as their
tracks are incomplete or damaged

messages.subject: SHQ.com UPDATES
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, Hirotada Tokugawa (M) added a fact sheet about Matsudaira Katamori http://www.shinsengumihq.com/katamorifacts1.htm please check it out....if there are
messages.messageBody:
Hello,
Hirotada Tokugawa (M) added a fact sheet about Matsudaira Katamori
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/katamorifacts1.htm
please check it out....if there are any comments/corrections and
suggestions about anything please contact shinsengumihq(a)yahoo.com

------------------------------------------------------
[Off-Topic] *for new members who have never read one of my film
rants before*
I highly recommend the Christmas movie TOKYO GODFATHERS (on dvd
available at Blockbuster) from the same diretor of PERFECT BLUE and
***MILLENIUM ACTRESS*** (contains Shinsengumi cameo AND the 2nd disk
shows a Shinsengumi cosplayer they used as a model AND starring RK
Saitou's voice actor Hiroaki Suzuoki AND animates Boshin War art).

***MILLENIUM ACTRESS*** basically takes you on a tour of Japanese
history via film...and plenty of inside jokes for people who love
chambara....film made me cry...

yes I know from the title TOKYO GODFATHERS it doesn't sound like a
Christmas movie...but trust me it IS a great film for the holidays
and deserves alot of attention...all 3 OUTSTANDING films by the
director Satoshi Kon...please do yourself a favor and view these
great works

lastly
if you haven't already seen this...
http://www.livejournal.com/users/ito_kashitaro/10143.html
Shimada Kai would've loved these Shinsen-cookies
